title: Faridabad family kills daughter-in-law, hides her body in pit outside house
content: In Faridabad, a shocking incident unfolded where a woman, Tannu Kumar, was allegedly murdered and secretly buried by her in-laws. For two months, they concealed the crime by reporting her missing. Tannu's father, Hakim, suspected foul play upon seeing a freshly covered pit outside their house, but claims police initially ignored his concerns.

title: From 99 to 100! Yashasvi Jaiswal's century celebration leaves Vaibhav Suryavanshi starstruck - WATCH
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal displayed remarkable resilience, scoring a fighting century against England at Headingley despite battling hand cramps. The young Indian star's aggressive innings, featuring 16 boundaries and a six, propelled India forward. Jaiswal's hundred places him among an elite list of Indian batsmen with centuries in their maiden Test innings in England, before his innings was ended by Ben Stokes.

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is requiring numerous corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle and Arlington, creating anxiety amidst job insecurity and AI-driven workforce reductions. Affected employees face short deadlines to decide, with no severance offered for those who resign instead of moving. This relocation push intensifies Amazon's in-office requirements and aligns with warnings of upcoming AI-related layoffs.

title: Israel hammers Iran: Trump mulls bunker busters - will Xi rescue Ayatollah?
content: As tensions escalate between Israel and Iran, China remains cautious, offering rhetorical support but avoiding military intervention. Despite a strategic partnership and economic ties, Beijing prioritizes its own interests, including energy security and avoiding entanglement in a conflict with US-backed forces. China's approach reflects a broader strategy of non-interference and risk aversion in the Middle East.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill matches Kohli’s feat, joins elite club with century at Headingley
content: Shubman Gill marked his Test captaincy debut with a remarkable century against England at Headingley, becoming the fourth Indian to achieve this feat. His composed innings, featuring elegant strokeplay and confident footwork, anchored India's innings on the opening day. Gill's leadership debut signals a promising new era for Indian cricket, blending composure and class.

title: Op Sindhu: Iran lifts airspace ban to evacuate 1,000 Indians; 3 planes flying out
content: Iran has eased airspace restrictions to facilitate the evacuation of approximately 1,000 Indian nationals, primarily students, from Mashhad via charter flights. This follows relocation from Tehran after recent Israeli attacks. Operation Sindhu was launched by India to ensure the safe return of its citizens from Iran and Israel amidst escalating hostilities.

title: OpenAI CEO says Elon Musk abused govt power, praises Trump administration for...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has accused Elon Musk of abusing governmental power to gain an unfair competitive advantage, particularly concerning Project Stargate. Altman expressed disappointment, admitting he was wrong in his initial assessment of Musk's actions. He also voiced his appreciation for the current administration's efforts to counter such behavior, emphasizing the unfortunate implications for the country.

title: Israel uses 'Barak' defence system to intercept Iranian drones - video
content: The Israeli Air Force has operationally deployed its indigenous “Barak” air defence system for the first time, intercepting an unmanned aerial vehicle that entered Israeli airspace. Simultaneously, the Israeli Navy revealed its inaugural combat use of the “Barak Magen” naval variant, successfully intercepting eight Iranian-launched drones.

title: BJP spent Rs 1,494 crore in 2024 polls; Congress Rs 620 crore: ADR report
content: Bharatiya Janata Party spent approximately Rs 1,494 crore in the 2024 Lok Sabha election. Association for Democratic Reforms reveals this information. Congress spent Rs 620 crore. Political parties spent on publicity and travel. Election Commission received expenditure statements late. Some parties' statements were unavailable. ADR recommends more transparency in election spending. They suggest monitoring party expenditure like individual candidates.

title: 'But I have to go to ... ': PM Modi says turned down Trump's invite for Odisha visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi revealed he declined a dinner invitation from US President Donald Trump during the G7 summit in Canada. Modi prioritized attending a public program in Odisha and visiting the revered land of Mahaprabhu.

title: When Steve Jobs gifted brand new Jaguar to secretary after he got late to office
content: Steve Jobs, known for his demanding leadership, once gifted a late secretary a Jaguar to prevent future tardiness, showcasing his paradoxical nature of being both intimidating and inspiring. Ron Givens, Apple's former quality director, shared anecdotes of Jobs' unexpected generosity and relentless pursuit of excellence. Jobs' high expectations extended to late-night calls, as recalled by Pixar's Pete Docter.

title: ITR e-filing: What is the benefit of pre-filled ITR forms? Top points
content: Income Tax Return Filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department is enhancing ITR filing for FY 2024-25 to improve accuracy and reduce taxpayer burden. Pre-filled forms may include more data like capital gains and deductions, sourced from brokers, depositories, and employers. This aims to minimize errors, ensure full income disclosure, and reduce litigation by addressing mismatches early.

title: 'She was to be my daughter-in-law’: 55-year-old man marries son’s fiancée
content: In Rampur, Uttar Pradesh, a shocking incident unfolded as 55-year-old Shakeel married Ayesha, the woman initially engaged to his 17-year-old son, Aman. This unexpected union has left Shakeel's family in turmoil. Shabana, Shakeel's wife, revealed his frequent communication with Ayesha after their daughter's wedding. Despite family resistance, Shakeel allegedly forced the match.

title: 'No talks until... ': Iran rejects nuclear dialogue with US after Trump sets deadline
content: Amidst ongoing conflict with Israel, Iran has rejected any nuclear negotiations, dismissing U.S. outreach efforts. Foreign Minister Araqchi insists talks are impossible until Israeli aggression ceases, accusing the U.S. of complicity. Despite this, Araqchi met with European ministers in Geneva, as Europe attempts to de-escalate tensions.

title: Dwyane Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shows support for Victoria Monét in heartfelt post
content: Gabrielle Union is set to moderate Victoria Monét's book launch event in Los Angeles for her new children's book, 'Everywhere You Are.' Union reposted Monét's announcement on Instagram, expressing her support for the book, which explores themes of love and connection. The event promises a discussion and Q&A session, with both mothers and authors sharing their insights.

title: What makes Yashasvi Jaiswal different? His former RR teammates explain
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal on Friday joined the elite list of Vijay Manjrekar, Sourav Ganguly, Sandeep Patil, and Murali Vijay by scoring a hundred in his first outing in England. The 23-year-old fell for 101 on Day 1 of the first Test against England in Leeds.

title: IND vs ENG: Jaiswal slams third ton vs England, continues dream run in Tests
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal, the young Indian opener, showcased his exceptional form by scoring his fifth Test century on Day 1 against England at Headingley. His commanding innings of 144 balls, including 16 fours and a six, solidified his position as a dependable red-ball batter.

title: 'Meanwhile in Lebanon': Missiles above, music below as Beirut party goes viral - watch
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, a viral video captures a surreal scene in Beirut, Lebanon, where people were seen partying as missiles flew overhead. This occurred following Israel's "Operation Rising Lion," which targeted Iranian strategic sites, including nuclear facilities, resulting in reported casualties.

title: IND vs ENG: Pujara mocks Vaughan's 4-0 prediction on Live TV, demands signature on failed post
content: Cheteshwar Pujara playfully trolled Michael Vaughan by presenting him with a framed copy of his incorrect prediction of a 4-0 India whitewash in the 2020-21 Australia Test series. The incident occurred before the first Test between India and England, amusing fellow commentators like Sunil Gavaskar and Harsha Bhogle.

title: 'Historic step': UK MPs back assisted dying; bill heads to House of Lords
content: The UK Parliament took a significant step towards legalising euthanasia as MPs approved a bill allowing assisted dying for terminally ill individuals in England and Wales. The proposal, which requires approval from doctors and experts, aims to provide dignity and choice to those with less than six months to live.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill achieves multiple milestones on Test captaincy debut - in numbers
content: Shubman Gill began his Test captaincy with a blazing half-century against England at Headingley, reaching the milestone in just 56 balls. Gill's impressive innings marked his fastest Test fifty and highest score in England, solidifying his role as a leader during India's transitional phase. He became the youngest Indian to score a fifty on Test captaincy debut.

title: Heat advisory in US: Best and worst drinks for extreme heat, stay hydrated during a heatwave
content: During a heatwave, staying hydrated is crucial for health. Prioritize water, coconut water, and oral rehydration solutions to replenish lost fluids and electrolytes. Avoid alcohol, sugary drinks, and excessive caffeine, as these can worsen dehydration. Eating hydrating foods and maintaining a consistent drinking routine are also essential for staying cool and healthy.

title: Musk bets on India: Tesla to open showrooms in July; ‘Made in China’ EV may cost more than $56,000
content: Tesla is set to debut in India this July with showrooms in Mumbai and New Delhi, importing Model Y SUVs from its Shanghai facility. Despite high import duties pushing the price above $56,000, Tesla aims to penetrate the cost-conscious Indian market.

title: Abdul Carter breaks silence: Reveals reason behind jersey no 51, fans moved by emotional backstory
content: Abdul Carter, the new linebacker for the New York Giants, has chosen jersey number 51. He reveals that this number reminds him to stay humble. Carter wants to earn his place in the NFL. Coach Brian Daboll praises Carter's focus. Fans are eager to see Carter play this fall. They are also curious about the meaning of his jersey number.

title: IND vs ENG: Did Manjrekar take a dig at Kohli in commentary? Watch
content: During the first Test between India and England, Sanjay Manjrekar's commentary sparked debate with a remark seemingly aimed at Virat Kohli. Manjrekar praised openers KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal for their disciplined approach, contrasting it with a 'former batter' known for chasing wide deliveries.

title: IND vs ENG: Did India backpedal on Shardul? Gambhir's past comment offers contrast
content: In a surprising move, Shardul Thakur was selected for the first Test against England, despite head coach Gautam Gambhir's previous inclination towards younger players like Nitish Kumar Reddy. With a new captain and the retirement of key players, Team India enters a new era. Thakur's inclusion, possibly influenced by his past success in England, signals a pragmatic shift in selection strategy.

title: Day 8: Israel targets Iran's interal security headquarters
content: The Israeli Air Force conducted strikes in Tehran earlier this week, targeting Iran's "Internal Security headquarters" and the headquarters of its "special internal security unit," according to military sources. The IDF, acting on precise intelligence, employed fighter jets to attack these key internal security mechanisms, which are integral parts of the Iranian regime's military apparatus, located within the Tehran area.

title: 8-hour silence after morning quarrel; elderly couple, son found hanging
content: A Kolkata family of three, Sarajit Bhattacharya (70), Gargi (68), and their son Ayusman (38), were found dead in their apartment, in Rajdanga Gold Park. Police suspect financial strain and the son's depression led to the tragic suicide. A note stated, "We are surrendering ourselves to God," requesting a joint cremation.

title: IND vs ENG: Debut disaster! Sai Sudharsan registers rare low for India after 14 years
content: Sai Sudharsan's Test debut against England at Headingley turned sour after India's promising start to the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy series. The highly-rated batter, receiving India Test Cap No. 317, fell for a duck after edging a Ben Stokes delivery. Sudharsan's dismissal followed a 91-run opening stand by KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

title: Liv Morgan’s WWE injury: RAW moment sparks chaos and concern, here’s where it all went wrong
content: Liv Morgan's recent shoulder injury on Monday Night RAW, during a match with Kairi Sane, has sidelined her for at least six months, potentially impacting her WWE career. The injury occurred shortly after the bell rang, leading to an immediate stoppage.

title: 'Heavy rainfall jumlas': Lalu shares AI video attacking PM Modi, CM Nitish; watch
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad Yadav released a satirical video targeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. The video criticizes the NDA's promises ahead of the 2025 Bihar elections. PM Modi visited Siwan, Bihar, inaugurating development projects. He attacked the Congress-RJD alliance. Modi highlighted Bihar's role in India's economic growth.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam wore burqa during 1,000km drive to UP
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, accused of her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon in Meghalaya, was apprehended after fleeing to Uttar Pradesh disguised in a burqa. Police investigations in Indore have questioned drivers who aided her escape, while in Shillong, Sonam and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha, remain in police custody as the probe widens.

title: Video shows Bengal school children using umbrellas in class under leaking roof
content: BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya has criticized the West Bengal government, led by Mamata Banerjee, for alleged neglect of school infrastructure. Malviya highlighted a situation in Hooghly district where 68 schoolchildren, aged 5 to 10, were forced to sit with umbrellas in classrooms due to a leaking roof.

title: Former Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia appears before ACB, questioned for over 3 hours
content: Manish Sisodia, a senior AAP leader, appeared before the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on June 20 for questioning regarding the alleged Delhi classroom construction scam. The ACB is investigating irregularities and a large-scale scam involving inflated costs in the construction of classrooms and school buildings. Sisodia's questioning, conducted with an independent witness, lasted from 11:00 am to 2:30 pm.

title: '60 fighter jets in action': How Israel pulled off overnight airstrikes on Iran - watch video
content: Israeli Defense Forces conducted extensive strikes on Iranian military targets, including the Organisation of Defensive Innovation and Research (SPND), linked to Iran's nuclear program. The operation involved over 60 fighter jets targeting missile manufacturing facilities and the SPND headquarters. These strikes are part of an escalating conflict, prompting diplomatic efforts from European officials as the US considers involvement.

title: From Holocaust to Hydrogen: How Israel become a 'nuclear power'; with help from US
content: Israeli leaders have consistently refused to confirm or deny the existence of nuclear weapons. The official line—repeated by every prime minister—is that Israel “will not be the first country to introduce nuclear weapons into the Middle East.” The sentence is a masterpiece of political sleight of hand: vague enough to deflect, but strong enough to deter.

title: Nifty50 ends above 25,100; BSE Sensex up over 1,000 points - top reasons for rally
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went above 25,100, BSE Sensex moved up over 1,000 points.

title: IND vs ENG: 'All the more special' - Karun Nair's wife Sanaya pens emotional post
content: Karun Nair's emotional return to the Indian Test team after eight years was celebrated by his wife, Sanaya Tankariwala, with a heartfelt social media post. Nair, who last played in 2017, replaced in the squad, marking a significant moment in his career. India, under new captain Shubman Gill, included Sai Sudharsan's debut in the first Test against England.

title: Bihar train accident: Railway trolly collides with Avadh Assam Express; 1 dead
content: A railway worker tragically died, and three others were seriously injured in Bihar's Katihar district when a railway trolley collided with the Avadh Assam Express. The accident took place on the Barauni–Katihar down line, prompting railway officials to dispatch a medical team to provide immediate assistance to the injured at the accident spot.

title: CM Nitish Kumar praises PM for caste census; asks Bihar voters to express gratitude
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar urged citizens to thank Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the decision to conduct a caste census alongside the 2027 population census. This follows Bihar's own caste census conducted between 2022 and 2023, which revealed that Extremely Backward Classes and Other Backward Classes constitute a significant 63% of the state's population.

title: IND vs ENG: India, England players observe minute's silence, wear black armbands
content: In a poignant tribute, the India and England cricket teams honored the 274 victims of the Ahmedabad air disaster with a minute's silence and black armbands at Headingley. The tragic crash, claiming the lives of Indian and British citizens, deeply affected both teams as they commenced their five-Test series.

title: 'Absolutely botched': How the Red Sox-Devers breakup got so messy
content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: Clark, Collier top early voting for WNBA All-Stars
content: Caitlin Clark and Napheesa Collier lead early voting for the WNBA All-Star Game. Clark is one of four Fever players currently in the top 10 of voting.

title: Ex-Blackhawk Toews signing with hometown Jets
content: Former Blackhawks captain Jonathan Toews, who stepped away from hockey two years ago for health reasons, plans to sign a deal to play for his hometown Jets, the team announced.

title: Ohtani, Tatis hit again as L.A.-S.D. feud boils over
content: Benches cleared, Shohei Ohtani and Fernando Tatis Jr. were both hit by pitches, and even the two managers got into it during another contentious affair between the Dodgers and Padres.

title: Ex-NBA star Divac breaks hip in motorcycle crash
content: Former NBA center Vlade Divac underwent emergency surgery after breaking a hip in a fall from his motorcycle in Montenegro, doctors said.

title: Pacers riding high, not celebrating Game 6 rout
content: The Pacers gave their home crowd plenty to cheer about in Thursday night's blowout win, including a highlight-reel dunk by Pascal Siakam, but they were in no mood to celebrate with Game 7 around the corner.

title: Durant buys minority stake in soccer club PSG
content: Phoenix Suns forward Kevin Durant has purchased a minority stake in Champions League winner Paris Saint-Germain, the Ligue 1 club said Friday.

title: Pirates reliever swipes at fan he says crossed line
content: Pittsburgh's Dennis Santana was involved in an altercation with a fan he said "crossed the line a few times" Thursday night in Detroit.

title: Oregon lands No. 1-rated safety, nephew of Kobe
content: Four-star prospect Jett Washington, ESPN's No. 1 safety in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Oregon over Alabama and USC.

title: The USMNT is a mess. That's the price of the U.S. becoming a 'soccer country'
content: The more the U.S. cares about soccer and produces better players, the more dysfunctional the USMNT becomes. That's just how it is.

title: Richards saves the day for the USMNT on a night when the front line couldn't
content: The United States has advanced at the Gold Cup, but the performances from the attacking players must improve.

title: Rankings of MLB starters, relievers and their arsenal of pitches over the past three seasons
content: A stat rooted in Game Theory reveals who's maximizing their arsenals, and who's leaving outs on the table.

title: Power Rankings: Can anyone unseat the Tigers at No. 1?
content: With a third week in a row atop our list, Detroit is the team with the most consecutive weeks at No. 1 in 2025.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: At Jackie Robinson's high school, a fire-ravaged city rebuilds
content: After one in four students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.

title: 'Not a Cinderella story': Coastal Carolina's rise as a college baseball power
content: Riding a 26-game win streak, the Chanticleers are on the cusp of a second national title in 10 years.

title: What an NBA title would mean for two generations of Pacers legends
content: Metta World Peace, Rik Smits and other Pacers legends reflect on Indy's run and what a title would mean for the city.

title: Club World Cup updates: Messi magic helps Inter Miami to famous win vs. Porto
content: Lionel Messi did what he normally does -- the incredible -- as Inter Miami stunned Porto to boost their chances of a place in the last-16. Here's what you need to know from Thursday, June 19 in the Club World Cup.

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

title: Who are the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class? We picked the top five at every position
content: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

title: Diamonds in the rough: Late-round gems of the 2025 NHL draft
content: These seven players are unlikely to be first-rounders, but all have a path to NHL success down the road.

title: Carlton Dotson's parole surprise and the aftermath of a 2003 murder
content: Carlton Dotson is no longer behind bars, while a Baylor coaching whistleblower is now a prison warden

title: MLB mock draft 2.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first 40 picks
content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: 'You know that's not normal, right?': Inside the rise of Pete Crow-Armstrong, MLB's next superstar
content: From flag football to Wrigley Field, PCA has been turning heads with his talent, energy and personality since he was a kid.

title: PLL Week 4 preview: What to watch at Whipsnakes' homecoming
content: The action heads to Baltimore this weekend. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: U.S. beats Saudi, clinches Gold Cup knockouts
content: Defender Chris Richards scored with a flick of the ball off a second-half free kick to lift the United States to a 1-0 win over Saudi Arabia on Thursday night, sending the Americans on to the Concacaf Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Messi ignites Miami's CWC with stunning winner
content: Lionel Messi scored his first goal of the expanded Club World Cup on Thursday with a patented free kick, giving Inter Miami a historic 2-1 win over Portugal's FC Porto.

title: Brazil's Botafogo upset UCL champs PSG at CWC
content: Igor Jesus scored a first-half goal, leading Botafogo to a stunning 1-0 win over the reigning European champions Paris Saint-Germain in the Club World Cup on Thursday in Pasadena, California.

title: Bayern, Kompany wary of 'dangerous' Boca
content: Bayern Munich will have no room for complacency when they face Argentina's Boca Juniors in their second Group C match, the German club's coach Vincent Kompany said on Thursday.

title: Manchester City fined £1m for delayed kickoffs
content: Manchester City have been fined more than £1 million by the Premier League for breaching the rules around delayed kickoffs and restarts nine times last season, England's top-flight league said on Thursday.

title: Source: Bayer in talks to sign Liverpool's Quansah
content: Bayer Leverkusen are in talks with Liverpool over a deal to sign defender Jarell Quansah, a source told ESPN.

title: Canada coach Marsch faces fresh Concacaf probe
content: The Canadian Soccer Association and head coach Jesse Marsch are under investigation by Concacaf over claims of rules violations and the use of offensive language.

title: Aké: Don't bring CWC's individual walkouts to Prem
content: Nathan Aké has told the Premier League to resist the temptation to copy the individual pre-game walkouts that have been introduced at the Club World Cup.

title: Rematch review -- a soccer game that's brilliant even if you don't like the sport
content: Sloclap's soccer simulation pares the beautiful game down to the essentials -- and it's a blast to play.

title: Hill or Rountree: Which fighter has the best UFC knockout?
content: Two of elite knockout artists in the UFC's light heavyweight division will square off in the main event at UFC Fight Night, but which fighter has the best KO victory?

title: Fantasy football: Values for CMC, Tyreek and more top storylines for 2025
content: Mike Clay, Daniel Dopp and Field Yates enjoy a robust conversation about the topics that fascinate them most heading into this fantasy season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool turn to Guéhi to replace Quansah
content: Liverpool will make a move for Crystal Palace center back Marc Guéhi. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Hundreds of ICF-made coaches running in special trains to be withdrawn
content: With increasing number of complaints from the travelling public and railway officials in the recent months, the Railway Board has directed that erstwhile ICF-designed Garib Rath Express coaches be withdrawn from passenger service with immediate effect

title: Court permits U.K. fugitive’s extradition to face sexual assault charges
content: Wanted by authorities in Scotland for rape, sexual assault, and indecent communication involving three women, Mr. Paul came to India after charges were framed against him.

title: New India is assertive, resolute and will no longer be a victim of terrorism, says Rajnath in J&K
content: Operation Sindoor is not just a military action, it is a warning to terrorists sitting across the border, and more than that — to those who support them, says Defence Minister

title: Anand Sharma slams Piyush Goyal for calling ASEAN the B team of China
content: The Commerce Minister’s remarks were ‘irresponsible and insulting’, the former Commerce Minister said, pointing out that ASEAN is India’s fourth largest trading partner. He argued that the agreements with ASEAN were diligently negotiated considering India’s interests, and in-built checks and review mechanisms were put in place

title: Prof. Kodandaram of TJS urges Centre to stop Polavaram-Banakacherla link
content: BRS leader Harish Rao accuses Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy of having a tacit ‘pact’ with AP Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on river waters issue

title: TTE returns bag containing valuables to passenger
content: He found the bag containing gold jewellery worth about ₹2 lakh and ₹37,000 cash in a coach of Gowthami Express

title: The AIADMK defends its role in Keeladi excavations, wants politics out of the issue
content: Deputy propaganda secretary K. Pandiarajan recalls that after the ASI decided not to pursue the Keeladi project further, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa stepped in. The State applied to the Centre for approval. The Central Advisory Board of Archaeology permitted the State to conduct excavations, which were done in stages. The reports were sent to the Union government

title: Karnataka’s major hydel reservoirs get double storage than last year due to early monsoon
content: The present storage can help generate 2,487 million units of power as against the level during the corresponding period last year which could have generated just 1,198 MU

title: Round-table meet demands transfer back of 5 villages from A.P. to Telangana
content: Telangana Jagruthi president Kavitha seeks taking up the issue at the PM’s meet with CMs of 4 States on June 25

title: Manipur districts tense after day of violence
content: A shutdown was observed in the Churachandpur district to protest the killing of a Kuki woman on Thursday

title: 8,583 students allotted seats in second phase free admissions in private schools in A.P.
content: Selected students to be informed through SMS, details also to be made available on website; action will be taken against schools if any student is denied admission without valid reasons, warns official

title: In special gesture, Iran opens its embattled airspace to allow flights carrying 1,000 Indians home
content: Acting envoy says India should join the world in condemning Israel’s “aggression”, warning that a failure to do so would “incentivise” others to attack their neighbours

title: Not happy with quality of polity in J&K: National Conference MP Ruhullah
content: His address to a civil society group in Sopore was not supported by local NC leaders, highlighting internal party tensions

title: ‘Chamayappura’ to demystify the art of make-up
content: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi’s national make-up workshop train 30 artists from across the country. Make-up artist Pattanam Rasheed will lead the workshop

title: Ready for discussions with A.P. on Bankacherla, but Centre’s step-motherly treatment towards Telangana not acceptable: Revanth
content: The urgency with which Centre responded after A.P. submitted the PFR is a concern, the Chief Minister pointed out stressing for a balanced approach in dealing with such sensitive inter-State issues

title: After a robust start, monsoon slips into lull phase
content: We expect a revival or another vigorous spell only by the end of the first week of July, says Neetha K. Gopal, IMD Director, Thiruvananthapuram

title: HMDA invites proposals for Land Pooling and Area Development, with an eye on investments
content: The consultant agency should identify at least 10 potential sites of around 5,000 acres each in consultation with HMDA based on the Master Plan, and prepare a concept report for each of these sites

title: Sharad Pawar signals MVA alliance for upcoming civic polls
content: Though formal discussions with the Congress are pending, we intend to explore a united front for the polls. A final decision will be taken soon, says NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar

title: Four leptospirosis deaths in two months; Thrissur on high alert
content: As many as 21 confirmed cases have been reported, with 26 people showing symptoms and seeking treatment in the past one and a half months

title: Kerala Sasthra Sahithya Parishath opposes plan to introduce uniform Kerala Studies course
content: KSSP says such a stance could undermine the academic autonomy and restrict the ability of universities to reflect regional, cultural and historical diversity of their syllabi.

title: Block panchayats to form ‘de-addiction anonymous’ groups to fight drug menace
content: Training programmes are also proposed for residents’ association representatives to involve them in anti-drug campaigns.

title: Kerala’s internal revenue generation tipped to cross ₹1 lakh crore in 2025-26, says Finance Minister
content: Balagopal says State finances will continue in recovery mode despite severe challenges on the fiscal front. The estimated growth is the outcome of improved efficiency in tax collection enabled by a comprehensive overhaul of the Taxes department in GST regime

title: Extract public commitment from Modi on continuing VSP in the public sector, CPI(M) tells Naidu, Pawan
content: People have been misled in the name of a revival package, and many employees have already lost their jobs, says party State secretary Srinivasa Rao; he also finds fault with the government spending ₹70 crore on Yogandhra programme

title: Raipur couple anxious as daughter in Iran is not reachable after her ‘rescue appeal’
content: Aiman Zaidi, 28, moved to Iran to live with her husband who is enrolled in an educational programme in Qom city in north central Iran. Apart from concerns of her safety, her parents are also worried if she would be able to get medical aid for her thyroid condition in the embattled country

title: Revenue employees should win public confidence through sincerity and service-mindedness, says official
content: Revenue Day is not just a celebratory occasion but a moment for self-assessment, says A.P. Revenue Services Association State president

title: Karnataka bike taxi riders left in limbo, call for regulation over blanket ban
content: Several bike taxi riders have begun shifting to food and quick commerce delivery platforms to sustain themselves

title: NHRC takes suo motu cognisance of moneylender ‘beating woman’ in Kuppam
content: The Commission directs Andhra Pradesh Chief Secretary and Director-General of Police to submit a detailed report in two weeks

title: PM’s speech neither fills anyone’s stomach nor provides employment: Tejashwi Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav alleged that, in the name of holding a government function featuring the PM, the BJP is organising political rallies, spending ₹100 crore of the State’s money

title: Railways to build subway across level-crossing adjacent to Tiruchi Town Station: Durai Vaiko
content: The State Highways Department and the railways have begun construction of an overbridge across the level-crossing on the Cauvery Road near the Railway Station

title: HAL wins ₹511-crore deal to build, own and commercialise SSLV launches
content: HAL emerged as the winning bidder among three shortlisted bidders; The PSU will initially make at least two SSLV rockets in two years with complete help and handholding from the ISRO, says IN-SPACe chairman Pawan Goenka

title: Kerosene supply set to begin in State
content: Antyodaya Anna Yojana cardholders will receive 1 litre of kerosene each, while other ration cardholders will get half-a-litre

title: Ramadoss should reject BJP and ‘politics of hate’, promote peace between the Vanniyars and the Dalits, says VCK MP
content: D. Ravikumar says his appeal to the PMK founder was born out of the concern that Dr. Ramadoss and the PMK should not “inadvertently” aid the growth of the BJP in Tamil Nadu

title: Hyderabad traffic police to use cameras on high-rises for ‘eagle view’ monitoring
content: While around 1,600 new vehicles are being added to Hyderabad roads every day, across the three Commissionerates, approximately 91 lakh vehicles are on the road daily, says Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand

title: Police handover bodies of three Maoists to their family members at Rampachodavaram in ASR district
content: The Maoists, identified as Uday, Aruna, and Anju, were killed in an exchange of fire on June 18 in the Maredumilli forest area

title: ‘Kerala Crime Files 2’ web series review: An intriguing sequel that improves upon the original
content: Without any of the hangover of the first season, despite some characters making a reappearance, the second season treads a fresh path, with veteran actors Indrans and Harisree Ashokan delivering what is required of them.

title: Upputhara panchayat to initiate revenue recovery proceedings against 27
content: Proceedings against 27 individuals to recover funds for fraudulently obtaining houses under LIFE Mission scheme

title: SC advocates’ bodies urge CJI to take suo motu case of ED summons to senior lawyers
content: Venugopal is the second senior counsel in the apex court, after senior advocate Arvind Datar recently, to receive summons from the Central agency; the ED later withdrew the summons issued to Venugopal

title: SCCL invites applications for Rajiv Gandhi Civils Abhaya Hastham scheme
content: Those who have cleared Prelims recently from Telangana may apply online from June 23 for financial assistance

title: Urgent need seen for integrating Indian Knowledge Systems in today’s education
content: Karnatak University hosts a special lecture on Indian Knowledge Systems as part of a refresher programme

title: ‘Modi, Nitish are not mass leaders’: Tejashwi Yadav mocks PM’s Bihar rally amid NDA-RJD war of words

title: Will Provide Security To Farmers In Vulnerable Areas: Manipur Government
content: A woman was killed and a farmer shot at in separate incidents in Manipur's Churachandpur and Bishnupur districts, respectively, on Thursday.

title: Can A Foreign Government Hack WhatsApp? A Cybersecurity Expert Explains How That Might Work
content: Iranian officials on wednesday, urged the countrys citizens to remove the messaging platform WhatsApp from their smartphones.

title: "Asked India For Ceasefire When...": Pak Deputy PM's Viral Admission On Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar has said the country was compelled to request a ceasefire with India last month after the latter struck two of its two air bases in Rawalpindi and Punjab province, as part of Operation Sindoor.

title: Madras High Court Stays Probe Agency ED Action Against Producer Vikram Ravindran, Associate
content: In a major setback for the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the high-profile TASMAC money laundering probe, the Madras High Court has stayed proceedings against Tamil film producer Vikram Ravindran and his associate.

title: Delhi To Host Yoga Events At 11 Locations, 20,000 Expected To Participate
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta announced that the Delhi government will officially celebrate International Yoga Day at 11 locations across the city, marking a significant scale-up in efforts to promote yoga.

title: Degrowth And Fashion: Upcycling Innovators Show How To Rethink And Reuse Waste
content: Every year, some 100billion garments are produced worldwide, and 92million tonnes of clothing waste end up in landfills.

title: This Technique Helps You Retain Information In Long-Term Memory
content: The proverb "practice makes perfect" highlights the importance of repetition to master a skill. This principle also applies to learning vocabulary and other material.

title: 5 Indie Art Spaces In African Cities Worth Knowing More About
content: Independent art spaces are collectives of artists (and others) who club together to set up a communal space  often in former industrial sites and more affordable parts of the city  to further their practice.

title: What Putin Said When Asked If He's Concerned World Heading Towards World War Three
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that he was worried when asked if he was concerned that the world was heading towards World War Three.

title: Is Mars Really Red? A Physicist Explains The Planet's Reddish Hue
content: People from cultures across the world have been looking at Mars since ancient times. Because it appears reddish, it has often been called the red planet.

title: Blinding Lights: The Hidden Science Behind Gambling's Glow
content: Theres a reason casinos rarely have windows or clocks, theyre engineered to make you lose track of time. But what if its not just time youre losing?

title: Putin Says "The Whole Of Ukraine Is Ours" In Theory, May Take City Of Sumy
content: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russians and Ukrainians were one people, "and in that sense the whole of Ukraine is ours," and said he did not rule out Russia taking control of the Ukrainian city of Sumy.

title: "They Don't Care For Any Other Country": Omar Abdullah On Trump-Munir Lunch
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah Friday said the US was a "friend" of other countries only till its benefits were served, and Washington can do anything to secure its interests.

title: Israeli Scientists Scramble To Save Work After Iranian Missile Hits Labs
content: Researchers at Israel's prestigious Weizmann Institute of Science have been scrambling to save their experiments after an Iranian missile destroyed a building containing dozens of cutting-edge laboratories.

title: PM Modi's Motorcade Makes Way For Ambulance In Bhubaneswar
content: The motorcade of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday gave way to an ambulance during his road show in Bhubaneswar.

title: International Day Of Yoga 2025: When India's Gift To The World Went To Space
content: Indian and Indian-origin astronauts have always shown their admiration for yoga as a core component of keeping themselves physically fit and mentally strong. The International Day of Yoga will be celebrated on Saturday.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash: 231 Victims Identified Through DNA Tests
content: Over a week after 270 people were killed in the Ahmedabad plane crash, 231 victims have been identified through DNA tests, and the mortal remains of 210 of them were handed over to their families, a health official said on Friday.

title: PM Modi Arrives In Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam For 11th Yoga Day Celebration
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam on Friday evening to lead the national event as part of the 11th International Yoga Day celebrations on Saturday.

title: 172-Acre Presidential Estate In Uttarakhand Now Open For Public
content: Nestled in the Doon Valley, the 172-acre Presidential Estate here has undergone a transformation from an exclusive retreat to a vibrant public space that celebrates biodiversity, heritage, and sustainability, a Rashtrapati Bhavan official said.

title: In New Era In Private Spaceflight, HAL To Operate Small Indian Rockets
content: In addition to making fighter planes, now Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) will also own and operate small Indian rockets.

title: What's wrong with the Aces? Breaking down Las Vegas' 5-6 start

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC Fight Night and PFL semifinals

title: Ranking the 10 most unbreakable records in college football
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: Recruiting intel from Elite 11 Finals and June's final official visit weekend
content: 20 of the nation's top high school quarterbacks convened in Southern California for the Elite 11 Finals . from Tuesday night to Thursday morning, 20 headliners convene in southern California . among the headliners are five-star passers in the 2026 ESPN 300 . a final round of official visits before the recruiting dead period from June 23 to July 31 .
